definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Are you willing to return, escorted by me?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意回去吗，由我来护送？

sentences.english: How time fast! The sun set. It is time to come back.
sentences.chinese: 时间过得真快呀，太阳下山了，我们也该回去了。

sentences.english: Well, for grad school, I'm probably going to go to Portland.
sentences.chinese: 对于进修的学校，我可能回去波特兰。

sentences.english: On the way home, several passersby wished me well.
sentences.chinese: 回去的路上，几个路过的人祝我好运。

sentences.english: Take them back and exchange them for another recommended pair of running shoes.
sentences.chinese: 把他们拿回去，拿他们换另外一双推荐的跑步鞋。

sentences.english: If one twin pushes, will the other push back?
sentences.chinese: 假如一个双胞胎推挤，另一个会不会推回去？

sentences.english: Then am I to go back empty-handed?
I figured the store would give us guff about exchanging it.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得要想把床退回去恐怕要费一番唇舌。

sentences.english: The old minister paid great attention to everything, that he might be able to repeat it to the Emperor on his return.
sentences.chinese: 老大臣非常关注细节，以保回去之后可以对皇帝重述。

sentences.english: I can’t go back and end this now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在不能回去并结束这一切了。

sentences.english: I rewound the tape and played her voice back to her.
sentences.chinese: 我把带子倒回去，把她的声音放给她听。

sentences.english: Just as I start to turn back home I hear it: the soft, two-toned whistle of chickadees .
sentences.chinese: 就在我转身要回去时，我听到了两声轻轻的山雀啼叫。

sentences.english: Bin sub these things you back.
sentences.chinese: 斌子这些东西一会你拿回去。

sentences.english: You may go back to the hotel so long as your fever allays .
sentences.chinese: 不用住院，只要不发烧，就可以回去。

sentences.english: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 因有好些犹太人，为拉撒路的缘故，回去信了耶稣。

definition: to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to be finished/to be done for/ruined/gone to the dogs/oh no
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
native place/place of origin/home state or region
it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
